An Android system can be asked to launch an activity (X) in a certain task (T). When an activity X begins with such a request, it will begin in task T. The package name specified in the manifest part of the app manifest is the name of the default task for an application.
Problem: A malicious program\'s launcher activity, activity M, has the ability to leverage task affinity to begin in the same task as a benign app. This gives activity M the ability to attack the benign app with a phishing or denial-of-service (DOS) attack.
